lines.content: - Whether I need to write Javadoc for custom exceptions.
- Writing Javadoc for my main `Steven` class and `TaskList` class.
- Helping me edit the Javadoc for my `Storage` class to be more clear and precise.
- The AI produced clear Javadoc templates quickly, which made it easy to make some minimal edits.
- Saved time: Instead of manually writing documentation from scratch, I could focus on editing the generated comments to be more accurate.
- What worked well: getting Javadoc generated quickly, with consistent formatting.
- What didnâ€™t: the AI sometimes gave slightly verbose Javadoc, so I trimmed it down.
- An estimate of 1 to 1.5 hours, as the TaskList class is the longest and requires the most Javadoc.

* Starts the command-line interface of the application.

This method prints a greeting, continuously reads user input and calls the getResponse(String input)
* method with the given user input.
* A helper for the run() method, it is continuously called with the user string input.

*

This method interprets commands using Parser, and performs the corresponding

* All changes to tasks are persisted via the Storage class.

* Thrown when the user attempts to add a task without providing a description.
* Thrown when the user does not follow the format for date and time when adding a task that requires it.
super("\tPls use the correct format for date and time, the format is dd-mm-yyyy tttt\n\t"
+ "tttt: time in 24-hour format, do not use colon (:)");
* Thrown when the user does not follow the correct syntax for marking and unmarking tasks as done.
super("\tPls use the correct format for marking/unmarking tasks");
* Thrown when the user does not follow the correct syntax for creating a certain task.
* Creates an instance of an InvalidTaskFormatException.
* @param taskType the type of task that the user attempted to create
super("\tPls use the correct format for " + taskType + " task");
* Thrown when a user attempts to add a Deadline task without specifying a deadline.
* Thrown when a user attempts to add a Fixed Duration task without specifying a duration.
* Thrown when a user attempts to add an Event without specifying the start or end time.
super("\tYour event from when to when????");

/** Injects the chatbot instance and greeting */
* The Storage class provides methods to save and load tasks
* to and from local storage in the form of text files.

*

The tasks are stored in an internal ArrayList that
* is managed by this class. Methods are provided to fetch tasks from
* a file, save tasks to a file, and load individual tasks into memory.
* Creates a Storage instance that is able to read from and write to the specified file.
* @param filePath the filepath of the text file from the root folder
assert filePath != null : "File path must not be null";
assert tasks != null : "toDoList must never be null";
* Reads tasks from the specified file and populates the internal list.
* @return an ArrayList containing tasks read from local storage, returns an empty list if the file is not found
* Parses a task string in its save format and adds the corresponding Task object to the internal list.
* @param task the text representation of a task in save format
public void loadTask(String task, ArrayList<Task> tasks) {
assert task != null : "Task should not be null";
* Represents a task that needs to be done before a specific date or time.
* Creates a new deadline task with the given description and deadline.
* The deadline must be provided in the format: dd-mm-yyyy tttt
* where dd is the day, mm is the month, yyyy is the year, and
* tttt is the time in 24-hour format.
* @param description the description of the task
* @param deadline the deadline string in the specified format
* @throws InvalidDateAndTimeFormatException If the given deadline string is not in the correct format
public Deadline(String description, String deadline) throws InvalidDateAndTimeFormatException {
assert deadline != null : "Deadline should not be null";
this.deadline = LocalDateTime.of(year, month, day, hour, minute);
* Additionally, adds a "[D]" at the front to represent "deadline" task, and the deadline at the end.
* Represents a task that start at a specific date/time and ends at a specific date/time.
* Creates a new event task with the given description, start time, and end time.
* The start and end time must be provided in the format: dd-mm-yyyy tttt
* where dd is the day, mm is the month, yyyy is the year, and
* tttt is the time in 24-hour format.
* @param description the description of the task
* @param startTimeString the start time string in the specified format
* @param endTimeString the end time string in the specified format
public Event(String description, String startTimeString, String endTimeString) throws InvalidDateAndTimeFormatException {
assert startTimeString != null : "Start time String should not be null";
assert endTimeString != null : "End time String should not be null";
this.startTime = LocalDateTime.of(startYear, startMonth, startDay, startHour, startMinute);
assert this.startTime != null : "Start time should not be null";
this.endTime = LocalDateTime.of(endYear, endMonth, endDay, endHour, endMinute);
assert this.endTime != null : "End time should not be null";
* Additionally, adds a "[E]" at the front to represent "event" task, and the start and end time at the end.
* Represents a task that takes a fixed amount of time.
* Creates a new fixed duration task with the given description and duration in hours.
* The duration must be an integer.
* @param description the description of the task
* @param durationInHours the duration of the task in hours
* Additionally, adds a "[FD]" at the front to represent "fixed duration" task, and the duration at the end.
//     * Additionally, adds a "[D]" at the front to represent "deadline" task, and the deadline at the end.
* Represents a task that can be marked as done or not done.
* This class provides methods to update and check the
* completion status of a task. Each task also has a description.
* Creates a new task with the given description.
* @param description a description of the task
assert description != null : "Task description must not be null";

  • {@code [X] description} if the task is done

*
  • {@code [ ] description} if the task is not done
* @return a string representation of this task

return "\tOK, DELETE THIS ONE ALR:\n\t" + deletedTask + "\n\tNow ur list got "
* Marks a task in the list as done.

return "\tYou only have " + taskList.size() + " tasks in your list";
return "\tOK, I will mark this task as done \n\t" + taskList.get(number - 1);
* Marks a task in the list as not done.
